presenter.name: Nonthalee Pausawasdi
presenter.title: Thailand
presenter.bio: Histology vs Cytology: Will core biopsy make cytology antiquated?

slide.title: Histology vs Cytology: Will core biopsy make cytology antiquated?
slide.titleNormalized: histology vs cytology: will core biopsy make cytology antiquated?
slide.text: Histology vs Cytology: Will core biopsy make cytology antiquated? Nonthalee Pausawasdi, MD. Faculty of Medicine Siriraj Hospital Bangkok, Thailand

slide.title: Guideline
slide.text: Sampling of solid masses and lymph nodes For routine sampling, 25 or 22G aspiration and biopsy needles are equally recommended When the primary aim of sampling is to obtain core tissue specimen, 19 aspiration or biopsy needle or 22G biopsy needle recommended Tissue processing Should include histologic preparation (cell block and/or formalin- fixed, and paraffin embedded-tissue fragments) and not to be limited to smear cytology

Technical performance of needle Tissue adequacy/ quality Diagnostic accuracy Safety Cost-effective FNA Aspirate Cytology FNB Core biopsy Histology Lesions Diagnosis Without ROSE “Lack of tissue architecture”

slide.title: 13 RCTs comparing FNA vs FNB 2012-2017
slide.text: 13 RCTs comparing FNA vs FNB 2012-2017 Aadam AA, Amick AE, Shah JN, et al. Gastrointest Endosc. 2014;79:AB188–9. Study N Lesions Compared needle & specimen type Diagnostic accuracy Other outcomes Bang, 2012 58 solid panc mass Procore 22 vs FNA 22 (ROSE/cyto/cell block) NSD (No significant difference) Similar safety profile Hucl, 2013 145 Solid panc mass&LN Procore 22 vs FNA 22 (histology) NSD for overall FNB: better in panc mass & FNA: better in LN Kim, 2014 22 SEL>2cm Procore 22 vs FNA 22 (cyto or histo) Not evaluated FNB: better adequacy & fewer passes Lee, 2014 116 Solid panc mass Procore vs FNA22,25 (ROSE, cyto, histo) NSD for malignancy FNB: higher ROSE accuracy for CA, fewer passes Vanbiervliet,2014 80 Solid panc mass Procore 22 vs FNA 22 (cyto and cell block) NSD for malignancy FNA: higher histologic quality Mavrogenis, 2015 27 Solid panc mass&LN Procore 25 vs FNA 22 (cyto and cell block) NSD for malignancy

slide.title: 13 RCTs comparing FNA vs FNB 2012-2017
slide.text: 13 RCTs comparing FNA vs FNB 2012-2017 Study N Lesions Compared needle & specimen type Diagnostic accuracy Other outcomes Alatawi, 2015 100 solid panc mass Procore 22 vs FNA 22 (histology) NSD (for malignancy) FNB; fewer pass, higher histo quality Kamata, 2016 214 Solid panc mass& panc cyst Procore 25 vs FNA 25 (histology) NSD FNB: higher histo quality, fewer passes Aadam, 2016 140 Solid mass, LN Procore vs FNA 22,25 (ROSE, cyto, histo) Not evaluated FNB: better adequacy Sterlacci, 2016 56 Solid panc mass Procore 22 vs FNA22 (cyto, histo) Not evaluated Han,2016 22 Gastric SEL Procore vs FNA 22,25 (ROSE, cyto,histo) NSD for malignancy FNB: higer adequacy, fewer passes Lee,2017 58 Solid panc mass&LN Procore 22 vs FNA 22 (histo) NSD for malignancy FNB: fewer passes Othman, 2017 109 Solid panc mass&LN Procore 22 vs FNA 22 (ROSE, cyto,histo) NSD

slide.title: 4 Meta-analysis comparing FNA vs FNB
slide.text:
4 Meta-analysis comparing FNA vs FNB Aadam AA, Amick AE, Shah JN, et al. Gastrointest Endosc. 2014;79:AB188–9. Study N Lesions Compared needle & specimen type Diagnostic accuracy Other outcomes Bang, 2016 576 Various masses, LN Procore vs FNA 22,25
NSD for overall and panc mass FNB: fewer passes Oh, 2016 896 various masses, LN Procore vs FNA 22,25
NSD for overall FNB: better in panc mass & histo core Khan, 2017 1024 SEL>2cm Procore 22 vs FNA 22
NSD FNB: fewer passes Wang, 2017 921 (8RCT) Solid panc mass Procore 22 vs FNA 22
NSD FNB: better adequacy, fewer passes

slide.title: Analysis of Fine-Needle BIopsy vs Fine-Needle Aspiration in Diagnosis of Pancreatic and Abdominal Masses: A Prospective, Multicenter, Randomized Controlled Trial

Outcomes (N=377) FNB (N=190) (procore 22) FNA (N=187) (Echotip 22) P value Overall diagnostic accuracy 91% 80% 0.0015 Pancreatic mass : Histology (N=249) 93% 82% 0.0099 Pancreatic mass : Histology 89% 79% 0.0047 Non-pancreatic lesions similar similar NS (published after the ESGE guidelines)

slide.title: Prospective assessment of the diagnostic performance of EUS-FNB (Acquire 22G) in abdominal masses (N=100)
slide.titleNormalized: prospective assessment of the diagnostic performance of eus-fnb (acquire 22g) in abdominal masses (n=100)
slide.text: CA gallbladder 1.7% Spindle cell tumor 1.7% Neuroendocrine tumor (NET) 1.7% Lymphoma 1.7% Leiomyoma 1.7% Disseminated cryptococcosis 1.7% Atypical cell 1.7% Epitheloid cell aggregation 1.7% Other (13%) Prospective assessment of the diagnostic performance of EUS-FNB (Acquire 22G) in abdominal masses (N=100) DDW 2018

slide.title: Diagnostic Performance of EUS-FNB for solid masses (n=100)
slide.titleNormalized: diagnostic performance of eus-fnb for solid masses (n=100)
slide.notes: Overall diagnostic performance of EUS-FNB ในการวินิจฉัย solid intra-abdominal mass had a sensitivity of 88.1% (95% CI,77.1-95.1), specificity of 100% (95% CI, 2.5-100), positive predictive value (PPV) of 100% (95% CI,93.2-100), negative predictive value (NPV) of 12.5% (95% CI,0.3-52.7), the area under the receiver operating curve (AUROC) of 0.941 (95% CI,0.851-1.000) with the accuracy of 88.3%. For detection of malignancy, FNB had a sensitivity of 97.7% (95% CI,87.7-99.9), specificity of 90% (95% CI, 55.5-99.7), positive predictive value (PPV) of 97.7% (95% CI,87.7-99.9), negative predictive value (NPV) of 90% (95% CI,55.5-99.7), the area under the receiver operating curve (AUROC) of 0.938 (95% CI,0.826-1.000) with the accuracy of 96.2%.
slide.notesNormalized: overall diagnostic performance of eus-fnb ในการวินิจฉัย solid intra-abdominal mass had a sensitivity of 88.1% (95% ci,77.1-95.1), specificity of 100% (95% ci, 2.5-100), positive predictive value (ppv) of 100% (95% ci,93.2-100), negative predictive value (npv) of 12.5% (95% ci,0.3-52.7), the area under the receiver operating curve (auroc) of 0.941 (95% ci,0.851-1.000) with the accuracy of 88.3%. for detection of malignancy, fnb had a sensitivity of 97.7% (95% ci,87.7-99.9), specificity of 90% (95% ci, 55.5-99.7), positive predictive value (ppv) of 97.7% (95% ci,87.7-99.9), negative predictive value (npv) of 90% (95% ci,55.5-99.7), the area under the receiver operating curve (auroc) of 0.938 (95% ci,0.826-1.000) with the accuracy of 96.2%.
slide.notesHtml: Overall diagnostic performance of EUS-FNB ในการวินิจฉัย solid intra-abdominal mass had a sensitivity of 88.1% (95% CI,77.1-95.1), specificity of 100% (95% CI, 2.5-100), positive predictive value (PPV) of 100% (95% CI,93.2-100), negative predictive value (NPV) of 12.5% (95% CI,0.3-52.7), the area under the receiver operating curve (AUROC) of 0.941 (95% CI,0.851-1.000) with the accuracy of 88.3%. For detection of malignancy, FNB had a sensitivity of 97.7% (95% CI,87.7-99.9), specificity of 90% (95% CI, 55.5-99.7), positive predictive value (PPV) of 97.7% (95% CI,87.7-99.9), negative predictive value (NPV) of 90% (95% CI,55.5-99.7), the area under the receiver operating curve (AUROC) of 0.938 (95% CI,0.826-1.000) with the accuracy of 96.2%.
slide.text:
PPV: positive predictive value, NPV: negative predictive value, CI: confidence interval, AUROC: Area under Receiver-Operating Characteristics curve
Diagnostic Performance of EUS-FNB for solid masses (n=100)

slide.title: Comparison of diagnostic performance of FNB with FNA (historical control; N=166) using propensity score matching (PSM)
slide.titleNormalized: comparison of diagnostic performance of fnb with fna (historical control; n=166) using propensity score matching (psm)
slide.text: Comparison of diagnostic performance of FNB with FNA (historical control; N=166) using propensity score matching (PSM)

slide.title: Diagnostic Performance of Cytology and Cell Block (FNA group, N=166)
slide.titleNormalized: diagnostic performance of cytology and cell block (fna group, n=166)
slide.notes: Diagnostic performance of cytology and cell block was assessed. Cytology 68.5% sensitive and 95.7% specific with AUROC of 0.821. Cell block had a sensitivity of 65.4%, specificity of 96% with AUROC of 0.807 (95% CI, 0.727-0.872). The performance of the combined cytology and cell block analysis was superior to either cytology or cell block alone as demonstrated by an improvement of sensitivity to 74.5% while maintaining high specificity of 96% with AUROC of 0.853
slide.notesNormalized: diagnostic performance of cytology and cell block was assessed. cytology 68.5% sensitive and 95.7% specific with auroc of 0.821. cell block had a sensitivity of 65.4%, specificity of 96% with auroc of 0.807 (95% ci, 0.727-0.872). the performance of the combined cytology and cell block analysis was superior to either cytology or cell block alone as demonstrated by an improvement of sensitivity to 74.5% while maintaining high specificity of 96% with auroc of 0.853
slide.notesHtml: Diagnostic performance of cytology and cell block was assessed. Cytology 68.5% sensitive and 95.7% specific with AUROC of 0.821. Cell block had a sensitivity of 65.4%, specificity of 96% with AUROC of 0.807 (95% CI, 0.727-0.872). The performance of the combined cytology and cell block analysis was superior to either cytology or cell block alone as demonstrated by an improvement of sensitivity to 74.5% while maintaining high specificity of 96% with AUROC of 0.853
slide.text:
Diagnostic Performance of Cytology and Cell Block (FNA group, N=166) 12 PPV: positive predictive value, NPV: negative predictive value, CI: confidence interval, AUROC: Area under Receiver-Operating Characteristics curve
Pausawasdi N, GIE 2015

slide.title: Conclusion
slide.notes: So, I’d like to break it down to 4 aspects that can be optimized to improve the diagnostic yield of EUS guided tissue aquisition
slide.notesNormalized: so, i’d like to break it down to 4 aspects that can be optimized to improve the diagnostic yield of eus guided tissue aquisition
slide.notesHtml: So, I’d like to break it down to 4 aspects that can be optimized to improve the diagnostic yield of EUS guided tissue aquisition
slide.text:
Conclusion
Core biopsy is preferable in the future where molecular analysis, immunostaining, and additional analyses required for diagnosis
